content: I think it's no big deal, but should new files added to mathlib be starting with Copyright (c) 2025 now (and is it worth updating common sources of Copyright (c) 2024 such as the contributor documentation)? I don't know enough about licensing to know whether this is pointless or important.
The copyright header which you can get by typing copyr + TAB automatically inserts the correct year
Ahh I suppose that is where everyone is getting their copyright header. I usually just copy-paste it from another file.
No problem :smile: It's not terribly discoverable
Is the conclusion that there is nothing to be updated, and accidentally using (c) 2024 is no big deal?
Are you sure people are accidentally using 2024? As a contributor, most of the code I'm currently submitting to mathlib is code I've written in 2024, not 2025
Well, I'm certain that I've been accidentally using 2024.
Some rudimentary searching suggest the copyright year mostly just determines the year that the material enters the public domain. So being a year off shouldn't be an issue.
Nick Ward has marked this topic as resolved.
